content:
Certainly! Here is a revised version of the Sermon on the Mount in rhyme form:

Blessed are the poor in soul,
For theirs is the kingdom whole.
Blessed are those who are sad,
For they will be comforted, not mad.
Blessed are the meek and mild,
For they will inherit the earth, so wild.
Blessed are those who crave righteousness,
For they shall be filled, not in emptiness.
Blessed are the merciful, kind and true,
For mercy they will find, and renew.
Blessed are the pure in heart and mind,
For they will see God, so divine.
Blessed are the peacemakers, pure in deed,
For they will be called God's children indeed.
Blessed are those who suffer for right,
For theirs is the kingdom, shining bright.

Rejoice and be glad, don't be blue,
For your reward in heaven is waiting for you.
You are the salt of the earth, so strong,
But if your salt has lost its flavor, it can't belong.
It's good for nothing, thrown away,
But if you keep your taste, you'll have your day.
You are the light of the world, so bright,
A city on a hill can't be hidden from sight.
It shines for all to see, so clear,
So let your light shine, and have no fear.
Men will see your good works and praise your Father on high,
Glorifying Him in all they do, and never shy.
